title: Some Parents Rush to Get Covid-19 Vaccines for Young Kids
summary: Resume Subscription. Younger children began to get vaccinated against Covid-19, adding to the nation's defenses against a pandemic that has upended learning and life for kids across three school years.

title: Scranton, Pa., Teachers Strike Over Pay, Healthcare
summary: Union at odds with school district following years with no contract. Hundreds of educators in Scranton, Pa., are taking to the picket line in the first major strike by a teachers union since the Covid-19 pandemic began.

title: Google to Pursue Pentagon Cloud-Computing Contract
summary: Company pulled out of bidding for similar project three years ago amid employee complaints about doing military work. Google is pursuing a massive cloud-computing contract with the Department of Defense, nearly three years after abandoning a similar bid process in the face of employee protests.

title: Roku Shares Fall 8% After Hours on Slower Account Growth
summary: The company added 1.3 million active accounts in the third quarter while analysts were expecting roughly 1.7 million. Roku Inc. reported a slowdown in new active accounts for its streaming services in the latest quarter and guided for lower-than-expected revenue for the holiday quarter, as global supply chain issues have affected new TV sales.

title: Facebook and Instagram Messaging Functions Back Up
summary: Chat tools were offline for several hours. The messaging functions on Facebook and Instagram suffered an hourslong outage Wednesday afternoon before appearing to come back online, the third disruption to Meta Platforms Inc. products in a month.

title: Los Angeles County Settles Lawsuits Linked to Kobe Bryant Helicopter Crash
summary: Board of Supervisors approves payments totaling $2.5 million to two families to settle legal actions over handling of crash-site photos by sheriff's deputies. The Los Angeles County Board of Supervisors approved settlements totaling $2.5 million for two families whose loved ones died in the 2020 helicopter crash that also killed National Basketball Association superstar Kobe Bryant and his daughter, Gianna Bryant.

title: Youngkin's Virginia Win Offers Midterm Road Map for GOP, Warning for Democrats
summary: Republican kept base energized without tying himself closely to Trump, while his opponent faced Democrat infighting over Biden agenda. WASHINGTON-The Republican victory in Virginia's race for governor and the party's unexpectedly strong showing in New Jersey, where the Democratic incumbent narrowly prevailed, gave the GOP hopes that it had found new strategies for regaining control of Congress next year, while leaving Democrats worried about a dispirited voter base.

title: Pentagon Review Cites Pressures, Mistakes in Deadly Kabul Strike
summary: General in charge of probe says U.S. forces were 'not unreasonable' in strike on aide worker's car. A Pentagon review of a U.S. drone strike in Kabul that killed 10 civilians in August concluded that American forces made a series of mistakes and misinterpretations-including failing to spot children nearby minutes before the strike-but said no international laws of war were violated.

title: Voters Cancel the War on Police
summary: From Seattle to Long Island, Americans voted against public disorder.. With crime surging in many cities, voters rejected the anti-police left this week. Minneapolis was the birthplace of the defund the police movement, but on Tuesday more than 56% of voters rejected a proposal to abolish the police department. The ballot measure would have replaced the MPD with a vaguely defined Department of Public Safety and eliminated from the city charter requirements for a police chief and a minimum level of police funding.

title: SEC Eases Path for Shareholder Plans on Environmental, Social Issues
summary: Under new guidelines, agency to be more receptive to proposals that have broad societal impact. WASHINGTON-The Securities and Exchange Commission reversed a Trump-era policy and acted Wednesday to streamline the process for shareholders to propose resolutions on environmental or social issues during the coming proxy season.

title: The Big 'Racist' Fail in Virginia
summary: Voters called 'white supremacists' elected a black Lt. Governor.. One salutary result from Glenn Youngkin's victory in Virginia Tuesday is the failure of Democratic racial demagoguery. Throughout the campaign Democrats and their media allies assailed Mr. Youngkin and his supporters as closet white supremacists. MSNBC's Joy Reid said the issue of education and critical race theory is "code for white parents don't like the idea of teaching about race."

title: New Jersey's Kitchen-Table Revolt
summary: The GOP barely missed a huge upset in a race fought over taxes.. Progressives upset about Tuesday's results are blaming the Republican surge on culture-war fury. That can't explain the race in New Jersey, where GOP candidate Jack Ciattarelli came close to victory with a campaign focused on the cost of living. The taxes and spending that voters rejected in the Garden State are a state-wide version of the Biden agenda.

title: When Can We Expect the New Jersey Governor's Race Results?
summary: The race between Democratic Gov. Phil Murphy and Republican Jack Ciattarelli is currently too close to call. Here's what we know so far.. The New Jersey governor's race remained too close to call Wednesday, with Democratic Gov. Phil Murphy and Republican Jack Ciattarelli trading the lead, separated by less than 1% of roughly 2.4 million ballots cast, according to the Associated Press.

title: House Democrats Add Paid Leave, State-and-Local Tax Deduction to Bill
summary: Proposal gives four weeks of leave to parents, the sick and caregivers, and raises $10,000 cap on SALT deduction to $72,500. WASHINGTON-House Democrats released an updated version of the party's social spending and climate package, adding back a paid-leave program that had previously fallen out of the bill and including a measure sharply raising the $10,000 cap on the state and local tax deduction.

title: Youngkin Clears a Path to Victory for 2022
summary: He focused on what he'd do for voters and kept a respectful distance from Trump.. Yes, Republican Glenn Youngkin's victory in the Virginia governor's race Tuesday was made possible in part by President Biden's lousy poll numbers. Mr. Biden is at 43% approval, 51% disapproval in the RealClearPolitics average-the worst standing of any modern president at this point except Donald Trump.

title: We're Safer From Climate Disasters Than Ever Before
summary: Though it receives little mention from activists or the media, weather-related deaths have fallen dramatically.. Editor's note: With November's global climate conference in Glasgow under way, important facts about climate change don't always make it into the dominant media coverage. We're here to help. Each Thursday contributor Bjorn Lomborg is providing some important background so readers can have a better understanding of the true effects of climate change and the real costs of climate policy.

title: Fox's Revenue Rises as Ad Sales Improve
summary: Fox Corp., parent of Fox News and the Fox broadcast network, reported quarterly revenue rose 12%. Fox Corp. , parent of Fox News and the Fox broadcast network, reported higher revenue in the latest quarter, as more original entertainment programming, live sports and growth at its streaming platforms boosted advertising sales.

title: Japan's Voters Endorse Getting Tough on China
summary: The weekend elections defied predictions-and gave Prime Minister Kishida room to step up defense spending, regional exercises and more.. Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party came away from Halloween with an unexpected treat. All 465 seats of the House of Representatives were up for grabs in Sunday's elections, and predictions for the LDP were frightening. But the party lost only a handful of seats. Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is now in a strong position to pursue tougher policies against threats from China and North Korea.

title: When California Snatched My Paycheck
summary: A cautionary tale for Biden's plan to let the IRS snoop via banks.. Many Americans are upset about a recent proposal by the Biden administration to let the Internal Revenue Service look at anyone's bank accounts that have more than $600 deposited.

title: The Biden Democrats Lose It
summary: The progressives' disastrous overreach fosters an emerging Republican coalition.. That was one sweet night.

title: 'The End of Craving' Review: Why You Can't Eat Just One
summary: We consume foods that are designed to fool the brain into believing it has received nutrition when it hasn't. Then we consume more of them.. The pandemic may be seizing our attention at the moment, but another health crisis, with a longer arc, is nearly as worrisome. Why has the incidence of obesity-contributing to disease and early death-been creeping dangerously upward in virtually all the world's countries for the past several decades? More specifically, why does the United States have an adult obesity rate, 42%, that is the highest in the world outside a few small nations?

title: Biden's COP26 Strategy Is to Blame China and Russia While Securing Climate Deals
summary: China's unwillingness to further narrow climate difference emboldens U.S. officials to call out Beijing, Moscow. GLASGOW-President Biden returned home from the United Nations climate summit Wednesday, having used the opening days of the conference here to try to paint China and Russia as isolated holdouts to a global consensus over fighting climate change.

title: At MetLife, Life Insurance Claims Rise for the Young Dying of Covid
summary: Allstate reports 55% decline in profit due to supply-chain inflation and growing wreck volume. Covid-19 cut into third-quarter results at MetLife Inc. as deaths linked to the Delta variant increased for people in their working years.

title: Qualcomm Posts Record Sales on Surging Demand for 5G Phones
summary: Company predicts shipments of 500 million to 550 million 5G handsets this year despite chip shortage. Qualcomm Inc. posted record quarterly sales and forecast further growth amid surging demand for 5G smartphones in the face of supply-chain constraints.

title: Powell Says Fed Acted Quickly to Tighten Stock-Trading Rules
summary: 'I think it's too soon to say what the reputational damage is' for the central bank in wake of trading controversy, says Fed Chairman Jerome Powell. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said Wednesday the financial market trading controversy that led to the departure of two regional Fed bank presidents caught the central bank by surprise, adding the Fed has acted swiftly to ensure the situation never happens again.

title: Fed Dials Back Bond Purchases, Plots End to Stimulus by June
summary: Central bank affirms forecast that factors driving high inflation are 'expected to be transitory'. The Federal Reserve closed a chapter on its aggressive, pandemic-driven stimulus when it approved plans Wednesday to begin scaling back its bond-buying program this month amid concerns that inflationary pressures could last longer than officials expected earlier this year.

title: Deere Says It's Done Bargaining
summary: Company says it has made its best and final offer; UAW-represented workers are discussing their next steps. Deere & Co. won't raise its offer to striking workers after a second vote to ratify a new contract failed Tuesday, a company executive said.

title: Inflation, Money Supply and Spiraling Expectations
summary: Expect the Fed to stay behind the curve.. John Greenwood and Steve Hanke's contention that excessive monetary growth is the cause of recent high inflation doesn't hold water ("The Monetary Bathtub Is Overflowing," op-ed, Oct. 22). Behind the 35.7% increase in M2 money supply that they cite-and attribute mainly to the Federal Reserve-lies $5.5 trillion of net spending power injected by the federal government. This was to offset the biggest short-term hit to aggregate demand in U.S. history. The Fed's quantitative easing changes the form of the "money" (purchasing power) that deficits create, not the amount.

title: Critical Race Theory From the Right Is Wrong
summary: We must try to teach history as accurately and objectively as we can.. I agree with F.H. Buckley's analysis of the corrosive effects of critical race theory on education ("History Is On the Ballot in Virginia," op-ed, Oct. 22). Yet Mr. Buckley also offers a claim typical of critical race theory: "The Revolution would likely have failed had Virginia not joined in, and its slave-owning planters had been angered by Lord Dunmore's emancipation proclamation."

title: Will Taiwan Fight for Its Freedom?
summary: The U.S. shouldn't care more about defending an ally militarily than the ally does.. Regarding "Is Taiwan's Military Ready For War? Few Think So" (Page One, Oct. 26): Taiwan appears unwilling to properly invest in and organize for its own defense. In that event, why should the U.S. be willing to sacrifice its blood and treasure to defend Taiwan? Why should the U.S. care more about defending an ally militarily than the ally does? If our ally won't do its best to prepare for its own defense, we may well be facing another Afghanistan-style fiasco in the event of war.

title: The Roots of the '80s Savings and Loan Crisis
summary: We can learn from the errors of the S&Ls and the political response.. While I agree with Dan Palmer and David Williams that the "Democrats' Tax Plan Would Sink Real Estate" (op-ed, Oct. 26), they are incorrect to lay blame for the savings and loan crisis on the 1986 Tax Reform Act. The S&L crisis occurred because the business model was to make 30-year fixed-rate loans but rely on a deposit base that could be withdrawn within 30 days. Due to high inflation, S&Ls were in trouble as early as the late 1970s.

title: Florida Is No Exemplar on Handling Covid-19
summary: Among U.S. states, it has the seventh-most deaths per 100,000 residents.. Dave Seminara writes that Covid infections have declined in Florida and celebrates that this was accomplished with fewer restrictions than in California ("Media Ignore Florida Covid Recovery, op-ed, Nov. 1). He fails to mention that Florida has the seventh-most deaths per 100,000 residents, whereas California ranks 35th among the states. I wonder if the families of the dead think the trade-off was worth it. Here in Florida, my friends and I have longed for more restrictions and more promotion of vaccines and masks so that we could feel safe.

title: Biden's Presidential Preparation at Penn
summary: The academic position was not merely remunerative.. Joe Biden's role at the University of Pennsylvania was excellent preparation for his presidency ("Prof. Biden and His Ambassadors" by Paul Levy, op-ed, Oct. 28). The academic position was a "vaguely defined role that involved no regular classes and around a dozen public appearances on campus, mostly in big, ticketed events."

title: Bed Bath & Beyond Stock Surge Recalls Meme Mania
summary: Retailer's shares jump as much as 54% after buyback, Kroger announcements. Shares of Bed Bath & Beyond Inc. jumped Wednesday, reviving a favorite meme-stock trade among individual investors.

title: Democrats Lose Grip on Gut-Level Issues
summary: Education and public safety drove debate in Virginia and New Jersey, as well as in Minneapolis, Buffalo, Seattle and New York City. There will be a lot of sophisticated analysis of Tuesday's election results, but the most important takeaway may be the simplest.

title: New York Times Profit Soars With Ad-Business Rebound
summary: Publisher warned about impact of promotional-pricing offer ending. New York Times Co. said net profit rose by 63% in the third quarter, boosted by a strong rebound in advertising revenue, but warned that the end of a one-year promotional-pricing offer ahead of last year's presidential election would pressure subscriber growth in the coming quarter.

title: Stocks Hit Records as Fed Scales Back Bond Buying
summary: Dow edges higher a day after blue-chip index closed above 36000 for first time. Major U.S. stock indexes hit concurrent records for a fourth consecutive session after the Federal Reserve approved plans to start scaling back its bond-buying stimulus program.

title: 'Great Escapes With Morgan Freeman' Review: Breakout Performances
summary: The iconic actor hosts an eight-part documentary series that tells stories of incredible getaways from Alcatraz, a Nazi POW camp and more. 'Some of the greatest stories ever told start behind bars," says the host of "Great Escapes With Morgan Freeman," and the actor is certainly right-several of the stories in his eight-part documentary series are so epic they've been told before, sometimes more than once. In fact, one of Mr. Freeman's own better known (and most beloved) films, "The Shawshank Redemption," is echoed throughout episode 1. But the allure of a show like "Great Escapes" is the way fact gets separated from dramatically enhanced fiction. And the perverse way it gets you to root for people you sometimes oughtn't be rooting for at all.

title: Emerson, Lake & Palmer's 'Pictures at an Exhibition' at 50
summary: The rock interpretation of Modest Mussorgsky's 1874 work of the same name was a surprise hit when released and remains powerful today.

title: Supreme Court Hears Arguments on Scrapping New York State's Concealed-Weapons Permit Law
summary: Comments from conservative justices point to concerns about law's restrictions, though scope of any decision is far from clear. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court's conservative majority voiced concern about a New York state law that limits the carrying of concealed weapons, in a case that could lead to the largest expansion of Second Amendment rights in more than a decade.

title: Options Activity Tied to Avis, Meme Stocks Explodes
summary: Avis activity hit the highest level in at least three years on Tuesday; heavy trading continued Wednesday. Traders are rushing to place options bets on Avis Budget Group Inc . and other meme stocks.

title: Activist Investor Holds Big Stake in Centene
summary: Newly established Politan is led by veteran activist investor Quentin Koffey. An activist investor has taken a big stake in Centene Corp. and wants the managed-care company to refresh its board and take other actions to boost its stock, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Marriott Posts Quarterly Gain From Leisure Travel
summary: Hyatt Hotels bounces back from a string of losses during the pandemic. Marriott International Inc. said continuing demand for leisure travel propelled gains in its recent quarter, while the spread of the coronavirus Delta variant hurt parts of its business from corporate travelers.

title: Maine Voters Reject $950 Million Power Line for Hydro Imports
summary: Backers of project claim ballot vote was unconstitutional, and the builder plans a legal challenge. Maine residents voted to reject a $950 million power transmission line under construction there to import Canadian hydropower, raising a hurdle for a long-pursued method of adding clean energy in New England.

title: Want to Cut Down Your Screen Time? We Put a Trendy Strategy to the Test
summary: Some tech experts recommend switching your screen to grayscale to curb a doomscrolling habit. It (sort of) worked.. I WAS INTRIGUED when, in a recent interview, Grammy-winning musician Lorde revealed the simple trick she uses to resist the kaleidoscopic temptations of her smartphone: adjusting her settings to switch to a grayscale-only display. Could a bleaker screen curb my own digital dependency, a habit the pandemic has only exacerbated?

title: Inflation Debate Can Wait as Fed Tapers
summary: The Federal Reserve has time to determine whether inflation will prove transitory before it has to make a decision on rates. Federal Reserve officials still think the run-up in inflation will prove transitory. Many investors disagree. For now, neither camps' forecasts matter that much.

title: Beholders (Thursday Crossword, November 4)
CVS Looks to Add Doctors to Its Payroll
summary: Pharmacy chain's CEO says physicians are critical for fulfilling its ambition to be a major healthcare provider. CVS Health Corp. says it needs doctors on its payroll to fulfill long-held ambitions of becoming a major provider of healthcare services.

title: Thousands in Air Force, Space Force Seek Exemption From Covid-19 Vaccines
summary: Facing Pentagon mandate, hundreds refuse shots; Air Force has approved 1,866 exemptions, with nearly 5,000 pending. At least 7,599 airmen and members of the Space Force haven't received a Covid-19 vaccine, either refusing to do so or seeking exemptions from military requirements, the Air Force said Wednesday, in a first set of challenges to a departmentwide mandate that troops be vaccinated to serve.

title: This Steak Sauce Recipe Is Magic on Leaner Cuts
summary: Make a luxurious meal of flank, hanger or skirt steak with a chunky caper-walnut sauce and a side of roasted beets. FOR A LEAN CUT of beef like flank, hanger or skirt steak, chef Tomos Parry favors this chunky, savory sauce. A combination of toasted walnuts, charred spring onions and radishes, chopped gherkins and capers, parsley and thyme, the sauce balances the beef with a bit of bite and lots of flavor.

title: Buffalo Mayor Race: Byron Brown Declares Victory Against Socialist India Walton
summary: Associated Press hasn't called the race that drew more write-in votes than those for the only candidate on the ballot. Buffalo Mayor Byron Brown declared victory in his write-in campaign against democratic socialist India Walton, who acknowledged Wednesday that she didn't receive enough votes to become the Rust Belt city's first female mayor.

title: Israeli Cyber Firm NSO Group Blacklisted by U.S. Amid Phone Hacking Allegations
summary: Commerce Department action will block trade with U.S. firms and could interrupt foreign contracts. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration on Wednesday placed Israeli cybersecurity company NSO Group on an export prohibition list that will restrict the firm from obtaining some types of technology from the U.S.

title: 'Life as We Made It' Review: Our Artificial Reality
summary: Human minds and human tools don't just reshape the physical world, but the very evolution of other creatures.. When the first European settlers arrived in America, huge flocks of wild passenger pigeons were observed in the skies. This phenomenon was initially documented in 1534 by the French explorer Jacques Cartier, who described the passage of a single flock as typically taking days to complete, largely obscuring the sun in the process. Successive mass slaughters, however, including one at Petoskey, Mich., in 1878, where approximately 50,000 birds were killed each day for nearly five months, reduced the passenger pigeon population from billions to none in a matter of a few decades. The last wild passenger pigeon was shot dead in Indiana in 1902.

title: Chinese Tennis Star Peng Shuai's Accusation Against a Retired Top Leader Causes Online Stir
summary: Athlete's post describing a relationship with former Vice Premier Zhang Gaoli that sometimes involved coercion disappeared after 20 minutes. A rare public accusation of sexual assault aimed at a retired senior Chinese official has rocketed around China's internet and turned a spotlight on perceived abuses by powerful political figures.

title: A Home That Could 'Never Be Built Again' Lists for $45 Million
summary: Resume Subscription. To reach Monica and Jacob Frydman's house in New York's Hudson Valley, visitors drive a quarter mile down a private road, across a set of train tracks and past an electronic gate flanked by sculptures of mythological temple guards, straight to the bank of the Hudson River.

title: Methane Regulations Are an Easy Win
summary: The EPA's tightened methane regulations were a low-hanging fruit, with little pain for oil majors and motorists. Stricter federal methane regulations are probably one of the few areas where environmentalists, oil majors and the top oil lobbying group are all on the same page. That makes it a slam dunk for President Biden.

title: What to Watch: Four Movies and Series to Stream
summary: From Netflix's 'The Harder They Fall,' a western about Black cowboys, to the Apple TV+ movie 'Finch,' featuring Tom Hanks after the apocalypse. In the dramas streaming this week, Idris Elba is being hunted in the old American West and Tom Hanks is trying to survive the apocalypse. Also, Judge Judy is back. Here's where to find them:

title: The Baby Bottles Were Cold-and a New Business Was Born
summary: This entrepreneur needed a way to keep bottles warm on the go. She came up with a solution.. How do you heat up a baby bottle when you're not near a container of warm water?

title: Hertz Files for Stock Offering, Applies to Return to Nasdaq
summary: Rental-car company says some shareholders are selling 37.1 million common shares. Hertz Global Holdings Inc . said some of its stockholders are selling 37.1 million common shares, as the rental-car company seeks to start trading again on a major stock exchange.

title: Do the Latest Wireless Chargers Beat Plugging In Your Phone?
summary: Wireless charging tech is finally reliable, but the question is whether eliminating a mess of charging cords is worth the trade-offs. A debate. For the recurring series, That's Debatable, we take on a contentious issue of the day and present two spirited arguments-one in favor and the other emphatically opposed. Previous installments from the series are here.

title: Voting-Machine Company Smartmatic Sues Newsmax and OANN
summary: Voting-machine company alleges the networks aired defamatory reports related to the 2020 presidential election; the networks have defended their coverage. Voting-machine company Smartmatic USA Corp. sued Newsmax Media Inc. and One America News Network over what it alleges were defamatory reports about the company's technology following the 2020 presidential election.

title: How to Get a Mixing Bowl With 'Downton Abbey' Cred
summary: Need the perfect gift for a cook? Hefty pottery from British heritage brand Mason Cash-still produced today and a fixture on series like 'Downton Abbey' and 'The Great British Baking Show'-has a rich history. Dig in.. EACH YEAR in early November, I retrieve our rickety old step stool, a high-school project of my husband's, and clamber up to reach the highest and deepest cupboard in my kitchen. From its shadows I slide out the large Mason Cash bowl I inherited from my grandmother. She used it, among other things, to make her Christmas pudding, stirring a silver sixpence into the mix to bring fortune to the lucky one who found it on his spoon (assuming he didn't choke on it first). Now I use it to make my Christmas cake, a ritual that has the frisson of a reunion between old friends and a seasonal communion with my grandmother. I imagine her stirring the rum into the bowl of raisins and fruit just as I do now.

title: Britney Spears's Father Seeks to End Conservatorship
summary: Hearing over 13-year legal arrangement was set for Nov. 12. Britney Spears's father requested to immediately end his daughter's conservatorship, the latest step toward ending the 13-year legal arrangement controlling the pop star's personal life and $60 million estate.

title: Discovery's CFO to Lead Finances of Company Formed by WarnerMedia Deal
summary: Gunnar Wiedenfels will serve as finance chief of Warner Bros. Discovery after the merger between Discovery and the AT&T unit closes. Discovery Inc.'s chief financial officer, Gunnar Wiedenfels, will run the finances at the company created by the planned merger between Discovery and AT&T Inc.'s WarnerMedia unit.

title: COP26 Negotiators Make Progress on Carbon-Trading Rules
summary: Companies hope a U.N.-backed framework for cross-border carbon markets will kick-start trading. GLASGOW-Climate negotiators have made progress toward a deal aimed at establishing the foundation of an international carbon-trading system, according to people familiar with those talks, putting within reach a long-stalled agreement that many businesses hope will kick-start a global carbon market.

title: In California's Napa Valley, a Home on 41 Acres Lists for $25 Million
summary: Resume Subscription. A roughly 41-acre property in California's Napa Valley is hitting the market for $25 million.

title: Sneaker Maker Allbirds Jumps in Public Market Debut
summary: The company went public selling its environmentally friendly approach to making shoes. Shares of sneaker maker Allbirds Inc. rose 64% in their market debut Wednesday, valuing the company at about $3.9 billion.

title: French-Australian Ties Deteriorate In Wake of U.S. Submarine Pact
summary: Paris and Canberra trade barbs over September's deal for Washington to share submarine technology with Australia. A diplomatic crisis between France and Australia deepened on Wednesday after senior officials on both sides traded barbs over September's landmark defense agreement between the U.S. and Australia, as geopolitical tensions over the accord continued to ripple.

title: 'Finch' Review: Man's Best Friends
summary: Tom Hanks stars as a man riding out climate apocalypse with his canine and robotic companions in Miguel Sapochnik's feature.. Transporting the "Cast Away" motif into a landlocked St. Louis, "Finch" finds Tom Hanks playing a post-apocalyptic Robinson Crusoe marooned in the Midwest-which, like the rest of America, has been reduced to a sun-blasted desert where daylight sears the skin and starving humans lurk in the shadows at night. It should be said right away that "Finch" is probably one of the more upbeat accounts of doomsday in the oeuvre of dystopic fiction, although the cheeriness can sometimes make what's terrible even more so.

title: EQT Selling U.S. Industrial Portfolio in $6.8 Billion Deal
summary: The sale of 328 facilities to a group led by an Asian sovereign-wealth fund is one of the largest ever for a U.S. industrial property. A unit of private-equity giant EQT AB has sold a portfolio of U.S. industrial real estate in a deal valued at $6.8 billion including debt, according to the company.

title: Aaron Rodgers Tests Positive for Covid, Raising Questions About His 'Immunized' Claim
summary: The Green Bay Packers star indicated during training camp that he had been vaccinated. But after his positive result, he has been placed into protocols for unvaccinated players.. Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers indicated in August that he was vaccinated against Covid-19. Now he has tested positive and been placed in the NFL's protocols for unvaccinated players, raising questions about whether he or the team violated the league's pandemic policies related to vaccines.

title: China Expands Nuclear Weapons Arsenal to Better Compete Globally, Pentagon Says
summary: An annual Defense Department report says Beijing is on pace to have about 1,000 warheads by the end of the decade, giving China more military options. WASHINGTON-China's military is expanding its nuclear arsenal faster than U.S. defense officials expected, as part of an overall modernization of its armed forces to better compete militarily with the U.S., according to a Pentagon assessment.

title: Youngkin Makes the GOP the Parents' Party
summary: Democrats squander their traditional advantage on education, and he finds a way to capitalize on it.. Charlottesville, Va.

title: Covid-19 Boosters Aren't for Everyone
summary: If you're healthy and young, a third shot gives no benefit, so it isn't worth even the small risk.. Healthy people in their 20s have been asking me about getting the third shot of the Covid-19 mRNA vaccines, recently authorized for older people. I've advised caution. More vaccine isn't always better.

title: Vaccine Boosters' Mix-and-Match Efficacy
summary: NIH study suggests which booster is most effective depending on whether you got the Moderna, Pfizer or Johnson & Johnson shot. Americans preparing to get a Covid-19 booster now can choose whether to stick with the same vaccine they had for their initial shots, or choose a different one. Are there advantages to mixing and matching?

title: The Mistakes Small Businesses Made During Covid
summary: Entrepreneurs came up against once-in-a-lifetime challenges in the pandemic-and some of them say they could have handled it better. Countless small businesses took major hits during the pandemic, much of it through no fault of their own.

title: Cathie Wood's ETF Buys More Zillow Shares Amid Steep Drop
summary: ARK Investment fund bought 288,800 shares Tuesday, the day the real-estate company said it would exit the home-flipping business. Cathie Wood's flagship exchange-traded fund bought roughly $25 million worth of shares in Zillow Group Inc . Tuesday, the day the real-estate company's stock plunged after it said it would exit the home-flipping business.

title: Behind the Numbers of the Virginia Gubernatorial Election
summary: What VoteCast tells us about how people voted Tuesday. Survey results of Virginia voters indicate that Republican businessman Glenn Youngkin beat former Democratic Gov. Terry McAuliffe by peeling away key voter groups that a year ago favored President Biden.

title: 'CoComelon' Owner Nears Sale to Blackstone-Backed Company for More Than $2.75 Billion
summary: Deal would mark second major entertainment acquisition this year for firm led by Kevin Mayer and Tom Staggs after Hello Sunshine deal. Moonbug Entertainment Ltd., the company behind hit children's shows "CoComelon" and "Blippi," is close to a deal to sell to a media company backed by private-equity firm Blackstone Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Biden Administration Orders Federal Agencies to Fix Hundreds of Cyber Flaws
summary: Agencies come under new pressure to close cybersecurity flaws after sometimes balking at such measures in the past. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration on Wednesday issued a sweeping new order mandating that nearly all federal agencies patch hundreds of cybersecurity vulnerabilities that are considered major risks for damaging intrusions into government computer systems.

title: Printer R.R. Donnelley & Sons Agrees to Deal to Go Private
summary: Atlas Holdings to pay $8.52 a share for R.R. Donnelley, whose shares surge nearly 40% on news. Commercial-printing company R.R. Donnelley & Sons Co. agreed to sell itself to a private-equity firm for about $2.1 billion including debt.

title: Boy Scouts Sex-Abuse Victims Hear Settlement Pitches
summary: Lawyers for different plaintiff groups have given conflicting information on what victims could receive. The Boy Scouts of America's push to settle sex-abuse claims from 82,200 men has touched off lobbying campaigns by plaintiffs' lawyers who disagree on whether victims should back a compensation plan that could be the organization's ticket out of bankruptcy.

title: Shortage of Truck Drivers Worsens Supply-Chain Mess
The Baseball Season Is Over. Is the Baseball Lockout About to Begin?
summary: The offseason will feature tough negotiations over a new labor deal that could well result in a lockout that could jeopardize the start of the 2022 season.. With the champagne yet to dry from the Atlanta Braves' championship celebration in Houston on Tuesday night, it was already impossible to ignore the $11 billion question looming over the baseball world: When will the next major-league game be played?

title: Glenn Youngkin Wins Virginia Governor Race
summary: Race ends years of Democratic gains in the state and gives GOP a playbook ahead of midterms. Republican Glenn Youngkin was elected governor of Virginia on Tuesday, halting a yearslong trend of Democratic electoral gains in the state and giving the GOP a potential playbook in competitive parts of the U.S. ahead of next year's congressional midterm elections.

summary: New St. Paul rules will limit rent increases to 3%, while Minneapolis city council will have power to draft some form of rent control. title: Texas Abortion Law Gives Glimpse Into Post-Roe World
summary: State provides window into what antiabortion advocates hope, and abortion-rights proponents fear, could spread nationwide. AUSTIN, Texas-Over nine weeks, a new Texas law effectively banning abortion after six weeks has transformed the state's abortion climate.

title: Fashion That Will Lift Your Spirits
summary: Feathers, sequins and tulle take center stage this season.. Sweet-as-candy colors, voluminous shapes and fantastical jewelry bring a childlike spirit of wonder to pieces from the fall/winter 2021 couture collections. Shot by photographer Dario Catellani and styled by Vittoria Cerciello, model Indira Scott wore playful creations including Alexis Mabille's bubblegum-pink tulle cape, a frothy Armani Privé dress and Schiaparelli's baby-blue-and-black ball gown. The standout looks were photographed against a balloonlike structure by set designer Mila Taylor-Young. Inspired by artist Tomás Saraceno's ethereal 2012 installation On Space Time Foam, which featured transparent films suspended in the air like giant bubbles, Taylor-Young's design offered a bouncy background for Balenciaga's oversize green coat and a Valentino Haute Couture romper and feathered pink hat. One all-white Dolce & Gabbana Alta Moda gown took the fluff factor to the next level, while an all-black Chanel Haute Couture dress offered the height of sophistication. -Jenny Hartman

summary: Voters warn Democrats to walk away from the Sanders-Pelosi agenda.. Democrats were reeling Wednesday from an election that repudiated the progressive agenda nationwide. summary: Trucking companies, freight brokers and shipping lines are reaping big gains as companies scramble to move their goods. The supply-chain crunch plaguing retailers and manufacturers is providing an earnings bonanza for freight carriers.

title: Minneapolis Rejects Measure to Replace Police
summary: Ballot measure would have replaced police department in the city charter with new department of public safety. Voters in Minneapolis rejected a ballot measure that would have replaced the police department in the city charter with a new department of public safety in the first municipal elections since the murder of George Floyd in May 2020.

title: Pfizer Raises Covid-19 Vaccine Forecast as Sales More Than Double

title: SEC Chairman Says Crypto Market Won't Mature Without Oversight
summary: Gary Gensler's comments Tuesday came a day after a Treasury Department-led panel issued a report on stablecoins, asking Congress to set up a regulatory framework. summary: Children as young as 5 years could start getting the shot as early as Wednesday in some places. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommended use of Pfizer Inc. and BioNTech SE 's Covid-19 vaccine among children ages 5 to 11 years, opening the door for immunizations to start.
